meanings.definition: Talk long-windedly without making much sense.
meanings.sent1: She blathers on and on about her day at school.
meanings.sent2: He always blathers about his latest conspiracy theories.
meanings.sent3: The parrot blathers in a funny voice, mimicking its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her mind blathers like a broken record, repeating the same thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The politician's blathering speech put everyone to sleep.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to his blathers; they make no sense.
meanings.sent2: The meeting was filled with blathers and no real solutions.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the silly blathers of the cartoon character.
meanings.sent4: His promises were just blathers, with no intention of keeping them.
meanings.sent5: The book was full of blathers, confusing the readers.
